Health & Safety for Licensed Child Care Providers, Module C
Section 2: Building & Physical Premises Safety

Children and Playground Safety

  • Swings
  • Slides

Swings

  • Swing seats should be made of soft materials such as rubber, plastic, or canvas.
  • Swing sets should be securely anchored to prevent tipping.
  • Swings should be at least 24 inches apart & no more than 2 in the same section of the structure.
  • Teach children not to:
    • swing on their tummies
    • stand on swings
    • twist swings
    • walk in front of swings
    • jump off swings
  • Make sure S-hooks on the swing chains are closed to form the shape of the number 8.
  • Make sure infants & toddlers in bucket swings are strapped in.

Slides

  • Metal slides can get very hot from the sun and can cause serious burns.
  • Slides should have a platform with rails at the top for children to hold.
  • Open slides should have sides at least 4 inches high.
  • Make sure there are no other children or debris at the base.
  • Donâ€™t go down the slide with children on your lap.
  • Teach children to go down the slide sitting and with their feet first.
